website_summaries.verdict: Costs a little more than some other sensors, but its ability to alert you to leaks via e-mail is helpful.
pros: Smart water leak detection system that allows you to name each sensor, so you know exactly where the leak is occurring
Will receive alerts by e-mail, audio alarm, and flashing light
Can be set up to track leaks in almost any location
Runs from a battery, so installation is a snap
cons: Can be tricky to hook up to your WiFi network
May miss water from some small leaks

customer_reviews.title: This unit can send text messages to phones too!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great!!! I was able to set it up to send notices to cell phones and email. Most wireless phone providers let you send emails that convert to text messages. During the device setup, you can specify several email addresses to receive notifications. I used the format of 1234567890@vtext.com to send text messages to my Verizon wireless phone. So now water leak alerts will be sent as text messages to a couple cell phones plus a couple gmail accounts. I ran several tests and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: A cautionary tale
customer_reviews.text: Three of the five I received detected "water" that wasn't there. So Three of five were defective. One would hope a product designed to perform so important a task might be at least reliable. I read reviews before purchase and I should have taken them more to heart. This is the first review I've written about a product and I do so from an impulse of regard for people wishing to be alerted before a house flood. This product is to be avoided.
customer_reviews.author: laura hooper

customer_reviews.title: saved us a lot of trouble down the line.
customer_reviews.text: this water monitor already saved me a lot of trouble. Put them all over my house wherever we have a sink or water. We have a double vanity in our master bathroom and one of the drains started leaking very slowly. Alarm sounded with just a very small puddle inside the vanity. This could have went unnoticed until it damaged the vanity or until the leak got worse. An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure monitors are also reusable, just remove it from water, fix the leak, and put it back to do it's job again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob V

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Yikes! I fixed a toilet. Later that day, a family member called me and said, "There's a beeping coming from the toilet and I don't know what it is." Little did I know that the seal I just installed leaked a little. The alarm went of on the sensor. What a lifesaver! I wiped up the water, fixed it again, then went away smiling that not damage had been done. Needless to say, I ordered more for every location I could think of in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Hiking Viking

customer_reviews.title: Half better than whole.
customer_reviews.text: Both units worked fine when purchased and then one malfunctioned. Luckily we were home to hear the second alarm go off loud enough to hear upstairs. Only half the basement flooded before we were alerted!
customer_reviews.author: Cody H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product w/bad batteries included
customer_reviews.text: Great product idea for houses on slabs with pipes above ceilings. Easy install & reliable email alerts. My only issue is that the batteries included lasted less than one day before I started to receive audible low batttery chips and alerts via email. FYI: Buy quality lithium batteries with order.
customer_reviews.author: OnlyGetsWilder

customer_reviews.title: One is DOA, and they come with old batteries!!
customer_reviews.text: One of them is DOA. Fine, I'll contact them and get a replacement. But what also bugs me is the product description clearly states that you must use fresh alkalines with extended expiration dates (with a picture of a battery with a 2023 date). However, the batteries that I paid for with this product expire in 18 months (Dec 2020 as of the date I wrote this review). That's BS. 9v batteries are expensive and I expected to have what I needed in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life and my money!
customer_reviews.text: I was not all that confident in these little things, but having had toxic mold sickness I know the importance of finding leaks quickly. I put these under my sinks and basically forgot about them - until it screamed at me to find it. It was loud and there was no mistaking or dismissing it. There was a small leak in the dishwasher system that would never have noticed but would have slowly caused extensive damage and mold. Paid for itself more than 100 times over!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Work fine just not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: First, they are kind of large and noticable if you use them anywhere someone may see (such as behind toilets). But, I primarily bought these because our air handler is in the attic and I was concerned that if the drain backed up, we wouldn't know until too much damage had happened. However, these aren't quite loud enough to be heard unless the house iof very quiet. They work fine for areas around the hot water heater and behind the washer or even under the kitchen sink but if you need to hear it through more than just a wall, you might want to upgrade to the wifi version.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought these at the end of November as we have occasional flooding in the basement. It was a mild winter, so no wet events until this last week when the irrigation ditches around the property were opened up for the spring. (We get seepage into the basement from these.) Well, no response from the alarm when the water started coming in this last week (early May). See photo. It is sitting in the water stream. Unit was tested when installed last December. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: CKayaks

customer_reviews.title: Battery
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the product came with a defective battery. In order for me to give an accurate review of this product the battery that comes with the item should work and it does not. Other than the low battery the product appears to be in working order. The alarm is loud and it sent an email notice when water was detected. Battery must be in good condition in order for the device to work properly though.
customer_reviews.author: jbk

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Received prompt delivery by Amazon as usual. Was in a blister pack that appeared un-opened. Battery activation tab was not present. The battery was installed reversed and the unit is DOA. Battery meter showed the battery to be totally dead Left message for Zircon technical support but will just send back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: These work very well
customer_reviews.text: I have these under every sink and behind every toilet in my home. These work! I have been alerted to two leaks since having these. One underneath the kitchen sink and another at the base of a toilet. When the alarm goes sounds, it produces a series of three beeps followed by a pause and another series of beeps. It stops beeping when you dry it off and then you just put it back where it was and that’s it! Just remember, water made the Grand Canyon and long term water damage is very expensive to repair. Very pleased with these water leak detectors.
customer_reviews.author: ABGM

customer_reviews.title: Saved my butt.
customer_reviews.text: I was preparing for brain surgery so wanted to tie up many loose end just in case. I had a sump pump that was going on 17 years old. I bought the pump but hadn't installed it yet. Too many things and this one had to wait. Surgery went fine but was recovering and heard an alarm going off somewhere. My wife is looking all over to determine what it was. Turns out it was this water alarm at my sump. Thankfully it alerted us before it had spread more than 3 inches from the sump. It could have been many thousands in damage as I have a finished basement with a very nice home theater. It worked great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kempisty

customer_reviews.title: Works great but alarm should be LOUDER.
customer_reviews.text: Instantly detects water. I put it on a rag (to increase "range" of sensing) on basement floor next to clothes washer and sure enough a few days later I heard it going off, ran down and found washer leaking. But the problem is I was right above it on first floor. If I was on second floor i would've never heard the alarm going off. It's hardly louder than say a maximum volume beep from your phone that you've got a text msg waiting - but the function of this (at least for my purposes) is a lot more important than your average text msg!
customer_reviews.author: K. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Comes with useless battery
customer_reviews.text: I think its a good product and will help with finding water leakage when it happens What I don’t like is zircon says battery included and then send a non functioning China made cheap 9 volt battery which didn’t work on arrival . It made me question their brand and quality . I don’t know if i did right by getting pack of 5 instead of 2 .. time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Been working great for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Works great when I've tested it with water. Love that it alerts you when the battery is low. TIP: Mine doesn't text me (it emails) which I prefer of course. Every phone service does have a special email code so that you can email someone and it shows up as a text. Just have to google it. So I actually get texts now. Only thing I don't like is the special battery you have to use. Wish it could just run on a couple of AAAs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Lot of Safety
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try and flood proof four rentals in condominium complexes. HOAs are getting pretty wary of flood damage by less observant owners and tenants and this is a good way to be proactive in preventing flooding. I just installed the battery, dropped them into the leak pan of the water heater and briefed the tenant on how they worked and what to do if triggered. I liked the quality of them too (I have some other tools made by Zircon). Seems that they are engineered to trigger in very little moisture and seem to be well suited for a number of different situations.
customer_reviews.author: Oscarphone

customer_reviews.title: Zircon wants to make customers happy
customer_reviews.text: Just received product & instructions say only use battery with at least 3 yrs beyond installation date. This battery only has one year left til exp date. Very disappointed for high price. Forced to return product! UPDATED: I contacted Zircon directly before returning & they couldn’t have been more accommodating. They are sending out 5 batteries with at least a 3 yr exp. date. Once they arrive & I try product I’ll update again.
customer_reviews.author: Lives to read!

customer_reviews.title: good product, expensive to maintain
customer_reviews.text: I just spent $20k on a basement renovation, $40 for this sensor is a no brainer to let me know if water is leaking and about to destroy my investment. Because I am not in the basement every day, if there is a water leak it could continue for days! The setup is easy and fast, and the text message with the wifi function works fantastic. Great product! My initial review was the first day I installed the sensors. I am editing this review after 7 days of use and all 3 batteries were drained. I will be returning this product ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zircon Leak Alert Electronic Water Detectors Are BIG and LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: For a peace of mind, we decided to try out the "Zircon Leak Alert Contactor Pack - Electronic Water Detector with Audio Alarm (8 Pack)" after we are some remodeling done. We tested out a handful of them and they seem to work fine. While some reviewers had experienced a low battery alert, we have not experienced a similar issue to date. Durability can only be determined with time. What we can say is that the device is a lot bigger than we were hoping for. And it can be very loud so you will be able to hear it beep in case of a leak a floor up/down. The price was quite high for a pack of 8 however...
customer_reviews.author: DHTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: No longer working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on December 29, 2017. No longer working 😒 not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: EllenG

customer_reviews.title: Saved my ass more than once!
customer_reviews.text: I never even knew these existed until I bought a house where the previous owner had them all over. Behind the washer, under the toilets, by the sump/ejector pits, by the water softener and hot water heater, you name it. I’ve had terrible luck with plumbing in the new house resulting in water leaks where these gave me early warning, the latest being a burst braided steel sink connection (I thought braided steel wasn’t supposed to burst) at 4:30a. Still, if I wasn’t home, that would have been a disaster so I see some of the WiFi versions in my future. A must have for anywhere water can leak!
customer_reviews.author: ceestep

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I like the design
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I like the design. For some reason I was thinking the sensor was the round opening on the top of the device when it's laying flat, there's actually a metal sensor that runs on the side and to the bottom. That makes way more sense, very happy with this product and seems to work great. I touch even just slightly wet fingers to the sensor and it starts going off immediately. The email notifications were not instantaneous though, there was a few minute delay on each of the tests I ran. Still really good protection though, I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bellz

customer_reviews.title: great value - works great.
customer_reviews.text: A great value. Was exactly what I was looking for. Easy to setup. You can set it up to send to multiple emails if it detects water. If you want a text, most celluar carriers allow you to receive a text via email - for example, for verizon, you use <yourcellnumber>@vtext.com.
customer_reviews.author: BrianS

customer_reviews.title: I sure like these alarms
customer_reviews.text: So far I have placed these water sensors in a number of home locations as they work GREAT. One under my water heater, one under the kitchen sink, one under each of my two guest toilets, and two under my big aquarium. Put them anywhere water is ‘contained’ but will cause water damage if you are not aware of a leak . Let me tell you they sound off in plenty of time so you can do MINOR plumbing repairs before it becomes MAJOR damage. Yes, they have sounded off several times to tell me there was an issue. Do schedule a regular battery change for each unit.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dave

customer_reviews.title: This Product works!
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased a resale home and found one of these detectors when we were cleaning a rarely used upstairs bathroom. Unknowing we set off the alarm and found this little detector placed under the toilet tank on the floor. As we don't care for the unwanted surprise of a leaky pipe or a wet ceiling, we searched on Amazon for the same detector. We purchased a number of these detectors and installed them in each bathroom and in the laundry room. And yes, they came with batteries!! A great little leak detector that actually lets you know that a problem is about to get worse.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Booth

customer_reviews.title: Products works but the installed battery tossed low battery errors
customer_reviews.text: I did the setup on this and kept getting low battery warning. I replaced it with my own new battery and went through the setup and the product worked fine. I tested it in my basement and the wifi signal worked and email reports came. The only other bizarre thing it seems like I keep getting the same time stamp on every warning. This replaced the "dumb" zircon unit that just beeped. So at least now I have the beep plus the email alert. 4 stars for the bad battery and weird email time stamps
customer_reviews.author: M. Vigod

customer_reviews.title: Ships with almost dead battery
customer_reviews.text: Within 3 minutes of receiving email confirmation of successful setup, I received the first low battery notification. Off to a disappointing start, but will update review after a few weeks of use. Update July 2019: Failed when we needed it most. Despite a relatively new battery and monthly check-ins, it never triggered an alarm when there was an actual leak. The entire bottom of the cabinet was soaked and the leak detector was found floating in it... useless.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but I couldn't get it to work, so returned it. My smartphone said, ""Ready to connect when network quality improves." I entered the IP address, but could not access the initial set-up screen. Frustrating waste of time. Way too complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Customer FD

customer_reviews.title: Everybody ought to have these
customer_reviews.text: My condo has NO floor drains, so whenever anything leaks or drips onto the floor, I need to know it immediately, or I'll flood my entire apartment to a depth of 1/4". These units are incredibly simple and unsubtle. You put them on the floor next to the dishwasher, washing machine, bathroom, and ignore it. If everything goes well, you'll forget they're even there until next year when it'll demand fresh batteries. But if the thing ever starts screeching, you'll be mighty glad you found out before you ruin your carpet, baseboards, and wooden flooring. It's like a five dollar lifetime insurance policy. Heck of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Grebner

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all home owners
customer_reviews.text: I setup and installed 2 of these inside the walls. Tested and working great. I will probably add 2 more of these in the house, and also add a smart valve closer for the water main. This way if a leak happens while I'm away I will be notified and able to remotely kill the water to the house until I can attend to the issue.
customer_reviews.author: jchop

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a older home and thought these would be cheap insurance due to the fact that Florida is allowed to use CPVC pipe as distribution in houses. Bought 8 pack and placed them under every sink, toilet, water heater, wash machine, everyplace that I can physically see that could be a potential leak. (Unfortunately don’t know how or where it runs thru the walls). Set them on Tuesday and today (Friday) my wife calls me and said that one of my alarms are going off, thankfully it was not a major leak (sink overflow section which can be siliconed sealed until I replace the sink) So In my book these just paid for them selves.
customer_reviews.author: Twotone

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I put these all over my house under sinks, and next to the water heater and it works amazing it has already gone off twice do to water going into my cabinet form my sink and it alerted us that my faucet was not tight enough and we fixed it before we had water damage I would buy over and over again Note I have had this product about 2 months
customer_reviews.author: NaY

customer_reviews.title: simple solution to a problem
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the enclosed batteries: I purchased alkaline ones from Amazon. I placed the 5 around my basement and they detected when my air conditioning unit's hose clogged and started to leak on the floor. Also detected a condensation drip from the ductwork. I have them in key places (near the water heater, near the main water valve, near the back wall, etc.) and know that they'll just work. Good piercing sound. It shuts off when you dry the unit. Simple and inexpensive solution to detecting water.
customer_reviews.author: Karen P.

customer_reviews.title: Some difficulty with setup & poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: There were problems getting the device to connect to the network then the email setup timed out several times. After about six weeks I started getting a low battery notice on the factory supplied battery. I'm not sure how much trust I have in the device based on the first six weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: NEOK

customer_reviews.title: BEEP BEEP BEEP
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 5 pack after two separate water leaks. I put one under kitchen sink, one under each bathroom sink, water heater and wash machine, and where the main comes into the house. We fixed the. Water leaks and tiled the floors. Brand new washer and water heater. Then I placed the water detectors. I've had two go off with a small amount of water. One by washer and water heater and once under kitchen sink. I would of never seen either of the problems.
customer_reviews.author: happy in AZ

customer_reviews.title: I am not one to write reviews, but had ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to write reviews, but had to in this case. I recently bought a camp and soon after the sump pump failed and flooded my basement and heating system out. I bought this to alert me if it happened again. Well, it did, but this time I was alerted by email as expected! I drove to the camp and fixed the issue before it caused damage. This device paid for itself in less than 30 days from the purchase. Top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Saved me hundreds of dollars of water damage
customer_reviews.text: Can't always be home, and I have old plumbing and a weak outside wall. I've had at least one small leak when a wax seal broke on a toilet, and the next thing I know my wife has rushed up and down the basement stairs to rescue my boardgame collection! This solved the problem of knowing if there's a leak or flood at least twice now, by sending me an email letting me know it's detected water. FYI - you must have a device capable of wi-fi in order to set this Leak Alert up, and when you do, very important to turn off your VPN or you won't be able to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Mason J. Rourman

customer_reviews.title: These have saved me more than once
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent at detecting fluid leaks. I've had a couple of water leaks by my fish tanks and was able to stop them before they became serious thanks to these. I was also woken up in the middle of the night by the one under our kitchen sink. It turns out a can of scrubbing bubbles had burst and was leaking out of the cabinet onto the floor. We have an old linoleum floor that we're replacing soon but the liquid had already started eating into it by the time I got up. If this device hadn't alerted me the damage would have been much greater.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Walker

customer_reviews.title: These are a necessity!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased these several times including as a gift for a housewarming party. They have saved us thousands of dollars in cleanup and repair after small water leaks were detected. Every household should have these near water heaters, toilets, sinks, and refrigerators that have water dispensers. . . Also near water filters! The alarm will wake you up at night make no mistake about that! They do start to squeak when battery needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ann Emerson

customer_reviews.title: good quality easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value for the reassurance they offer. I have them under basement windows, behind the clothes washer, next to the water heater, under the kitchen sink, and behind the toilets. They are small enough to hide and smoothly styled so they fit in like any other normal fixture. The signal is easy to hear and easy to test. With my history of basement water issues, I find their effective range of detection is extended by placing them on a partially unfolded napkin that gets wet so any small trickle of water does not escape detection. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Please look for better options.
customer_reviews.text: This alarm is costing me hundreds of dollars. If it wasn't for me, that I checked my back up camera inside the sump pump room, my basement would have been completely flooded. I've never received an alert (sound/email) of any type from this device. (Whatever the failure was from this product, hardware, software, etc. No warning or notification was provided) So please, look out for better options as I wouldn't wish for this to happen to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Alerted in time during water leak
customer_reviews.text: I got the second one after the first decide saved lots of money by alerting water leak in my basement during a thunder storm. There was an audible alert and email alerts as soon as the floor was wet. Very easy to set up and works great ! Highly recommend it and worth the price !
customer_reviews.author: sv

customer_reviews.title: Decent water leak sensor
customer_reviews.text: Bought 20 (4 packs of 5) Zircon water leak sensors to place in cabinets underneath sinks (on Xtreme mats,  and next to toilets, water heaters, fridge, dishwasher, and washer/dryer. Batteries included, installs easily, and all 20 water sensors passed water test. Water sensor is supposed to chirp if low battery, will see if that happens with time. Will update review if product experience changes.
customer_reviews.author: NT1975

customer_reviews.title: It's fine for detecting water
customer_reviews.text: It's fine for detecting water, but getting the WiFi set-up was a pain. Tech support was VERY responsive, but essentially told me you could only do it from a phone, not from a computer. It also took several exchanges with them to get the steps to find the MAC address, which are: 1. Press the wakeup button in the Leak Alert Wi-Fi device 2. Connect to device Wi-Fi 3. Open an internet browser 4. Enter the following link: 192.168.4.1/debug.html I want to put the device in my sump pump pit to detect when the pump fails. So far that's not working, as it gets too damp in the pit and that sometimes triggers a detection.
customer_reviews.author: Ron O

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to setup. If you follow the instructions, you should be fine. I was initially disappointed it would only send alerts via email. I thought a text message would be better. I then remember you can send email that will become a text message on someone's phone. This example is for Verizon, but a quick search for: email text message InsertYourCarrierHere should give you steps for your carrier. In Verizon's case, the format is:9998887777@vtext.com where 999 is the area code, 8887777 is the phone number. I was able to send email to me and my wife, plus text messages to each of out phones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sensitive and very accurate moisture detector. I purchased and installed one in both my houses and it works great, easy set-up, and sends me a notification every week that it is active. I set my notifications to text message so I would immediately receive notifications. For the money, this provides a peace of mind that all is well. My wife tested it by wetting her finger and touching the sensor. Do not try this. It was so overwhelmed with the small amount of moisture, I had to reset the device. If it comes in contact with water, you will know it really quick. Just follow the directions and make sure you receive an initial set-up notification.
customer_reviews.author: bimoore

customer_reviews.title: Helpful device
customer_reviews.text: We like this product a lot. We have 12 of them & have had over a year. We had a toilet overflow & I walked away, heard the buzzer, ran & saw it draining on our wood floors into our living area hallway. Thankful it was caught, very helpful device. We have them through our home & a very helpful area (our basement). The drawback we have found is replacing the battery’s. They have needed to be replaced sooner then we would like and that takes a while when you own 12 of these. It still doesn’t prevent me from liking these.
customer_reviews.author: Love the Lord

customer_reviews.title: Great, but of course, make sure your WiFi is dependable if you want to rely on the email feature
customer_reviews.text: Setup is easy with the instructions and it does seem to work perfectly. Most likely, some of the reviews where this is reported to not send notifications could be due to bad WiFi locations. It does have the optional ability to test weekly by sending you a log also. All tests with this were good on both that were purchased. We did tape over the sound hole so it would not be so loud if it goes off. What a great idea with the email feature.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-K

customer_reviews.title: So far it works good.
customer_reviews.text: You even get an email when the battery is low. You also get a weekly email with a log of any tests that you ran or alerts. The device does work when testing with water on your finger across the 2 contacts and you get an email within 30 seconds. I'm buying another one for a different area of the basement today. Update - 30 days later - I did buy another one right away and both have been working great. Have never gone offline and they check in weekly with an email assuring me they are okay. I would recommend these to anyone !
customer_reviews.author: Gary K.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Arrived Low - needing immediate replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product earlier and found them easy to program. They have tested accurately and fortunately not been under "real water damage situation". Ordered another pair Feb 2020. One of the units BATTERY indicated that it was already LOW and needed to be REPLACED - right out of the box. The battery protection strip appeared to be in place - but the battery is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Placed these under every sink and appliance in the house. While working on the house manifold, a decent amount of water dumped onto the floor and this thing started screaming and flashing. Highly effective with even a slight amount of water. What's more, water got into the speaker area, and it continued to sound without problems. It's a robust little device which offers a great deal of peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: C.Graham

customer_reviews.title: Prevented a disaster!  Terrific product.
customer_reviews.text: Last week at 630AM, while away on vacation two hours away, the leak alarm in my boiler room sent me an alert. I raced home to leaking water system in another part of the basement, which was totally covered with 1/2 inch of water and immediately shut the water cut-off. Damage was under $1,000. If I did not have this alarm, I would have arrived home a week later to a fully flooded basement with three to five feet of water and structural damage to my home. I am buying a second to put in another corner of my basement, so that I get an alert even faster. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Critical  buyer

customer_reviews.title: Lousy battery
customer_reviews.text: The device Came with a battery however the device immediately sent the message “low battery “ and started beeping annoyingly that there is a “low battery” Replacing the battery would require re-programming the whole device which is not complicated but requires a number of steps again Replacing the battery would require re-programming the whole device which is not complicated but requires a number of steps again! .... four month later the device works (I test it every month) but again message came of “low battery”
customer_reviews.author: patricia samwick

customer_reviews.title: Good detector and easy to modify to convert to plug-in
customer_reviews.text: What I really wanted was a simple and reliable detector that I could plug in and not worry about batteries. This was the battery based unit I liked the best. I then wired it to a cheap 9V AC to DC converter and made my own wired water detector. No need to worry about changing batteries now.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great water leak alarm
customer_reviews.text: These are very good water leak alarms and I have had one for about 5 years. It started to act up a bit so I ordered more from Amazon and got a great deal on them. The only thing I do NOT like about these is the point the alarm goes off, you must disassemble unit to remove battery. So I installed a 12volt switch between battery and unit, I cut away some plastic to do this, for best fit. I tested unit and it makes it easy to reset after leak detected. I needed to change the kitchen faucet as that was the point where the water came from.
customer_reviews.author: Miller Tyme

customer_reviews.title: So worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These leak alarms have warned us 3 times of a leak, one of which could have been severe. I have recommended them to numerous people. A major leak from a second floor water heater is what prompted me to research and order these leak alarms. Highly recommend. Just bought a second set of these leak alarms for a relative who moved into a first floor 30 year old condo building. Hoping it saves them from water damage that other units have incurred.
customer_reviews.author: Ceri

customer_reviews.title: Alarm no longer functional
customer_reviews.text: After 10 months from purchase date the unit emailed me a message that the battery was low. I replaced the battery then determined the audible alarm was not longer working. I contacted Zircon several times requesting a repair or replacement. They did not response - very poor customer service. Update: I contacted Zircon a second time and they called me within 24 hours. They intend to send me a replacement unit and will update this review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: D Squared

customer_reviews.title: Quick mod makes it a silent alarm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure. Removed one star for having to unsolder the buzzer to make it a silent alarm. It would be easy for them to make this a setting. My bathroom shower sometimes backs up, when we’re home it’s usually not an issue as it’s a slow process and we can take action. Before any damage. But when we are away for extend periods of time, this becomes enough for us to notify someone who has our keys who can go check. Keep in mind that removing the buzzer voids any warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Muanis

customer_reviews.title: Even Catches Small Amounts of Water
customer_reviews.text: These are great and a great price for the peace of mind. I put them behind both bathroom toilets, under the kitchen sink, under the dishwasher and behind the refrigerator. Just the other day one started beeping behind the toilet in the hall bathroom and when I went in I found someone had used the plunger and some water had leaked out from the holder. The detector got it! Great peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Wiens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Setup took about 2-3 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Setup took about 2-3 minutes. Remove the place cover, pull the plastic strip, and make sure battery is installed correctly. Press the reset button, then use a phone to connect to the device using wifi. Use phone browser such as Safari or Google Chrome to log into the connected wifi device. Use  and follow the setup. Make sure you check your email for setup confirmation. If your using Gmail, google might put the setup confirmation email to spam. Make sure you tell google that this email isn't spam, or you'll never see your notifications.
customer_reviews.author: TechieYen

customer_reviews.title: Plumber recommended
customer_reviews.text: A plumber recommended these for my water heater pans in the attic in case they should ever fill up with water! Inexpensive insurance in case of leaks which could damage the ceiling. Going to get some for my AC units in the attic too. We tested the product before installing and it makes a loud beeping sound when the sensor touches water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WiFi EASY to set up. Great unit.
customer_reviews.text: This is the WiFi alert model. VERY easy to set up. Connected instantly. Notified my by email that my configuration was done. Immediately emailed me when I tested it. Picked up my WiFi signal in a heavily built, walled in enclosure with a lot of metal units inside. I wish I could shut off the audio, as cannot have it sounding in the middle of the night and waking people up (it's why I wanted the WiFi feature!) I'll have to disable it somehow. One star off for the price point and lack of audio control, but you can use it with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: GHL

customer_reviews.title: Works well. piece of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Loud alarm goes off that's easily heard if your home, but more importantly it shoots an email to your email address. Just gotta be checking your phone when your away from home. If your gonna be gone for a full 24 plus hours, like on a vacation, turn your water(main valve) off. If your hot water heater is in your living area of house, like a hallway closet, I would put one there. You can have multiple units in house. They are easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: CJM515

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Alarm!! Would definitely buy again!!
customer_reviews.text: These water detectors work very well! They are sensative enough to detect water early. Cannot place these back on the floor after mopping until the floor is completely dry, otherwise the alarm goes off. I keep these in the bathroom by the toilet and under faucets for early leak detection. Haven't gone off yet, but better to have them and not need them!! I would definitely buy these again!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Helpful device
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed that the battery that came with the device was so low it wout work until I replaced the battery. The water has to be very close to the device before the alarm goes off and the email is sent. Placed in the right spot this does alert you before water becomes a problem. The email alert enables you to get home or send someone if you're out of town. It would be nice if you could control loudness. If under a nearby sink the volume would be too loud. If in the basement it might not be loud enough.
customer_reviews.author: littlebit

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Very poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Batteries need frequent replacement which makes it useless for remote management which of course is the whole point of spending this much money on them. Very disappointing. They just silently fail when the batteries die. No warning. I typically get just 3 months of reliable battery life. Since I live in Los Angeles and these are used in Chicago, I can't come back every 3 months to replace the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: stevefoobar

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is Meh
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK device, but the battery only lasts about five months.
customer_reviews.author: J. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Low Battery Missing Messages
customer_reviews.text: A good product *except* more often than not the unit dies without sending a low battery alert. This is problematic as you cannot ping the device (to monitor alive) so you have to notice the missing emails and proactively change the battery. I bought this to monitor for leaks - now I have to remember to check every few weeks to see if the messages have arrived. Sound simple but so easy to forget...very poor design in that regard, a pity.
customer_reviews.author: Baz

customer_reviews.title: Battery killer
customer_reviews.text: Eats batteries. This item is worthless to me since it's in a vacation home and I can't replace the battery every time it dies. Maybe lasts about 1-2 months before a new lithium battery is needed. Plan on buying batteries in bulk if you purchase this item. I would not recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: stevestutz

customer_reviews.title: Works great,
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because I had difficulty connecting to my friends wifi network, could connect it quickly to mine but it was a gift for her. eventually got it figured out, was her network not a problem with the Leak Alert, appears to work fine, placed it in her garage which is sometimes prone to flooding on extremely rainfalls, set it up to send alerts to both her and myself. I like this product
customer_reviews.author: William A Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sensitive to moisture, but tha's what's great about it.
customer_reviews.text: I had no difficulty programming two Zircon Leak Alerts pairing them with my wifi router. I have two water heaters, one in the attic and one in the first floor utility room. Each alert is named and when tested I received email notifications indicating which one caused the alarm. They provide great peace of mind if traveling for extended periods of time. The only negative, and the one that drops this from a five star to a four star rating, was that the battery in each needed to be replaced within a couple of weeks. These are specialized batteries and not inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Plano Texas

customer_reviews.title: Constant alarm after two years
customer_reviews.text: The device barely lasted two years, before crapping out. The alarm sounds despite the contacts being dry (my hands are dry too). I replaced the battery to no avail. I'd look at other products.
customer_reviews.author: engageant

customer_reviews.title: It worked when the circuit flipped off and the water came up in the sump pit!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m thankful the WiFi alert worked this morning! The audible alert worked too but sadly is not loud enough for me because it’s under the house in the sump pit. I have another alarm down there too without WiFi and that one was going off but I didn’t hear that one either even though it’s louder. I gave four stars because it is not loud enough. It is a good alarm overall. Happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Scaricamazza

customer_reviews.title: Saved me from a water heater disaster
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use. Had to replace the battery after a year or so. But thank God I had this. Walked into my basement one day and heard the chirping noise. Opened up the area where the water heater was and saw it dripping (luckily right onto the unit). So was able to prevent a giant flood.
customer_reviews.author: Repoman

customer_reviews.title: Simple to setup,  works okay.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love they idea and form factor. Ended up with nonstop false positives so stopped using it regardless of the surface I had it on. This product is simple to setup. It acts as a hotspot you can connect to from your phone or laptop. Configuration is straight forward and fast. E-mail alerting works great. Unfortunately the false positives were an issue for me. You may or may not experience the same.
customer_reviews.author: Sidewinder7

customer_reviews.title: A good leak sensor at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: I use these behind the toilets, under the bathroom lavatories, and under the kitchen sink and the water heater. They are even louder than I expected, so I placed a strip of tape over the "speaker" holes to reduce the volume. These can be laid on their side or on their back, as the sensor terminals are on two surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Duke 1953

customer_reviews.title: After a month one started beeping with no water present ...
customer_reviews.text: After a month one started beeping with no water present. After pulling battery and letting sit starts again a few days later. Worthless noise maker at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Decent if it works
customer_reviews.text: I had bought two because my house was plagued with leaks and figured this would be awesome to alert me, instead of having to find a brand new swimming pool where my basement is supposed to be. One of them works fine and is still doing what it's supposed to be doing and giving me alerts every week, the the other is like lazy child that goes through batteries like it's at a cheap all you can eat seafood buffet. NO ZIRCON #2... you already had three batteries last month... what is wrong with you?!? 3 stars cause one works while the other doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: CraftyQiao

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Setting up took a while so five stars is generous. It finally connected and I tested it with only a wet finger and sure enough it started to chime and blink. It did take a few minutes to send the array of emails and texts I set up but it did send them. I’m using this device to detect any leaks an external aquarium canister filter might develop while it sits in a two gallon plastic bin. The filter is connected to a Wemo switch so if I am alerted to any leaks I can turn the filter off from anywhere...hopefully I never have to use it!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Alerted us in less than 24 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Tested and Proven in less than 24 hours when our sump pump stuck. The alarm alerted us twice in 24 hours. We placed it on the cement floor approximately 12 inches from pit. Device was loud enough to wake us in the night also. Batteries were included. We have only placed one in our home. We will check the others very soon and probably place under sinks and beside washing machine. WE WOULD BUY THESE AGAIN WITHOUT HESITATION. They would make a great gift for a housewarming. They saved us a lot of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: SavedbyGrace

customer_reviews.title: super sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had these long so not sure on longevity but they are super sensitive. Just the moisture in my fingers was enough to set them off while putting batteries in. Easy enough to get them to stop, just wipe dry with a paper towel. Loud enough to hear throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: dreamy

customer_reviews.title: Easy, simple, work well but...
customer_reviews.text: But, the beeps are in the SOS pattern, which is inappropriate for a water leak (non-life/death situation!). Would have been 5 stars if it weren’t for this. I’ve purchased these in past years, and these are great. Simple to set up and use. Easy to test. Could be made smaller in size and are a bit over-priced for their simple design (very low-tech). But, they work well, which is what I need. Already saved me from water damage once!
customer_reviews.author: Laura D.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I bought two of these for my basement, and the other day during heavy rains this did its job. A VERY small amount of water, less than a cupful, escaped my basement window well and ran down the inside wall. This leak alert was in the right place and detected that small amount and beeped its warning. Should my sump pump ever fail, I have no doubt that this will give the warning I would need. Very happy with this purchase. Excellent insurance for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DADuck

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use, just install the battery and set it down on the floor. We have one in the downstairs shower and another in the utility room, areas we've had water issues in the past. I wish it was louder - my wife couldn't hear it upstairs when I tested it. Hopefully it will upset the dog. At least we don't have the issue of it losing its wi-fi connection without us knowing it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice units
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of these before and bought another 5 pack. I like them... and the "SOS" Morse code beeping it makes so when you hear it you know it's coming from this water detector as opposed to other things you may have that beep. I've found battery life to be very good for the previous unit I've owned. My 5 pack included 9V batteries, which was nice (not alkaline though).
customer_reviews.author: Lantana Al

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up, All 5 Units Worked
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these for about a month, but they seem to work as advertised. All 5 units were very sensitive, they are easy to set up, and if they work as advertised are very long lasting. I plan to test them annually an replace the batteries every 4 years. I have had a dishwasher that leaked, since replaced, so they may save me from water damage for a very low price.
customer_reviews.author: Grady J.

customer_reviews.title: Saved our basement from a disaster.
customer_reviews.text: These alarms are super sensitive and very load. Recently we had a pipe burst while we were out and when we came home I heard the alarms going off. I ran downstairs to find my basement with about 2 inches of water in it. the alarms were floating and screaming. I shut off the water and silenced the alarms. Had we not had the alarms we would had gone to bed not know our basement was flooding and the damage would have been far worse. I highly recommend these,.
customer_reviews.author: D. Betz

customer_reviews.title: Both versions work well.  Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have both versions, and both sound an alarm that I can hear through both doors. Customer service was very helpful with directions and advice. If the water spill could splash on the device it should be placed under a container with slots that allow the flood so get to the underside of the device (see photo).
customer_reviews.author: Arty

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-up & Test
customer_reviews.text: We had experienced a major water leak from out dishwasher last year. So, we were primed for some kind of sensor. An in-law had recently purchased these and recommended. These appeared reasonably priced and simple; so, I purchased. These were easy to set up (install 9V battery) and easy to test (wet finger). Be ready to wipe off the electrodes to stop alarm. Purchased 2 more so that all areas are "armed." In retrospect, I looked at wireless sensors that would alert when away, but options were much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: QA Man

customer_reviews.title: Batteries had to be replaced IMMEDIATELY!--Otherwise excellent product
customer_reviews.text: . Make sure you put your own fresh batteries in the devices because the batteries that came with all 3 were nearly completely discharged and had to be replaced within ONE DAY. Once installed though the product works superbly--as long as your wifi router, wifi extender, or hotspot is within range.
customer_reviews.author: GhillieMan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to set up and paid for itself in the first month.
customer_reviews.text: This little bugger saved my bacon - again. Used it in a furnace room where a piece of conduit was throwing off enough condensation to stain the ceiling below. I forgot I had it and my wife and I couldn't figure what the hell that noise was. Tough to miss and perfect for this job. I checked my inbox and there were a bunch of emails from the device. The other day I received a notice to update my firmware. Hell, that's more than my TV does.
customer_reviews.author: wicked willy

customer_reviews.title: Great price for such an important little device
customer_reviews.text: I live in a condo and we're actually required to have these by the association after a series of leaks from various units. These little devices are amazing. I would have one even if it weren't required because they alert you at the slightest hint of moisture in the drip pan under your water heater.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It can’t hook up to my WiFi
customer_reviews.text: It can’t link to my WiFi. I follow all the instructions. I tried few times, the last step hook up to my internet indicated fail. I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: When my husband told me about these I was hesitate ...
customer_reviews.text: When my husband told me about these I was hesitate on whether they’ll work or not, he got them anyway; one night I loaded my wash machine and walked away without thinking that the load was too big making the water level system to go off. Thank God the alarm got water in it and started to make a very loud noice indicating that something was wrong. My lord this alarms work was my first comment. So, don’t think twice about getting these for your house.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz/ Gabe Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let this happen to you!
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows what happens when you go out of town while it’s raining and your sum pump fails... of course My leak detector’s alarm (my old device with out the WiFi connection and email alerts) was loud but I wasn’t home to hear it in order to act before ruining my washer, dryer, furnace... (good thing I have flood insurance). I ended up replacing the bad float switch on my sum pump and bought the leak alert with email alerts just in case. Better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: P.R.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind having this installed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great during my testing. set up on wifi, and added my email address, including forwarding to my mobile provider as a text message (I highly recommend setting it to text you,by mobile providers email messaging system). The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is I received a unit with a low battery. I will buy a new one and replace it later today and things should be good to go. After two basement floods in the last couple of years, I feel much better knowing I will be alerted if something happens. My next step is to install a floodmaster type system, that will shut off the water off a leak is detected.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Saves your home from water damage!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get these sensors after a flood in my bathroom. They are easy to use- just install batteries and set in place. I put them under my sinks, in the laundry room, behind the toilets and under my tankless water heater. They are ultra sensitive. If they come into contact with any amount of water, they will go off. This could save you a ton of time and money In the event of a leak.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi M

customer_reviews.title: This is AWESOME! It is user friendly and will give me ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Zircon leak alert. I read the instructions and did what it said and in less than 10 minutes it was all set up. It sent me a confirmation email. Then I tested it with water and it sent me an alert. This is AWESOME! It is user friendly and will give me peace of mind. Thank you whoever designed this!!! I just posted this on my Facebook page and told all of my children to get it, and I just ordered two more to put in my rentals! I am sooooo happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vineyard C.

product_meta.title: Zircon Leak Alert WiFi - Smart Electronic Water Detector Alarm with Email, Audio and Visual Alerts - Battery Included
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pack| Style:WiFi Email AlertThe Zircon Leak Alert WiFi smart water detector is a wifi water sensor and alarm that protects your property. This compact wifi leak detector allows for easy placement anywhere in any place that has potential for flooding or leaks such as near water heaters, sinks, dishwashers, sump pumps, and more. The Leak Alert WiFi is battery operated, wireless and fully automatic so no wiring or hub is required and all the limitations of hub-based wired products on the market are avoided. When moisture is detected, the wifi water detector will sound an 105 dB alarm, emit a visual warning by flashing a SOS, and will send an email alert via your Wi-Fi connection to up to five email addresses to warn you of the water leak. This could potentially save thousands of dollars in water damages. The Zircon Leak Alert WiFi eliminates the need for all the expensive accessory equipment by operating independently on a hub-less platform. Each unit operates independently of each other and can be individually named, allowing for an infinite number of units to be on guard protecting your space from water damage. Name each wifi water alarm during the set-up process (it is best to name each unit uniquely based on the location the device is utilized) and the emergency email will alert you of the exact location of the problem allowing for even faster intervention. Should a flood occur, the Leak Alert WiFi unit will float and continue to send out visual flashing alerts, an auditory alarm, and email notifications so it can be both seen and heard from a distance. Zircon designed this wifi water leak detector to chirp and send email notifications when the battery is running low and needs to be replaced. Each Leak Alert WiFi unit includes an easily installed standard 3V Lithium battery to keep your smart water leak sensor running at optimal performance. Just like your smoke detector, remember to check and replace your Leak Alert WiFi batteries every year. The Leak Alert WiFi is the perfect water detector for HOA, multi-unit, and multi-story property managements. It is also a great smarthome device to meet the needs of your property and protect your apartment, home or office. The Zircon Leak Alert WiFi allows you to save money and protect your entire property with one purchase.
feature_bullets: The Leak Alert WiFi smart water detector connects to Wi-Fi and immediately sends email alerts when even the slightest amount of moisture is detected

Name each wifi water sensor with its location during set up and email alerts will direct you immediately to the source of the alarm! Loud 105 dB alarm and flashing SOS alert even when Wi-Fi isn't available

Independent and hubless system allows an unlimited number of Leak Alert WiFi water detectors to be set up and running at any given time. Perfect for homes, schools, offices, hotels, property management, and more
Continuously monitors for leaks around sinks, dishwashers, appliances, refrigerators, washing machines, sump pumps, water heaters, hot tubs, water filtration units, and more

Fully automatic battery-powered operation - no wiring required for this smart water sensor. Like your smoke and carbon monoxide detectors, a low battery warning chirps an alarm when it is time to replace the 3V Lithium battery.Alarm sounds for upto 8 hours

specifications.Included Components: 1 Zircon Leak Alert Wifi Unit with 3v lithium battery and instructions
